description: Create Next.js App Router + Tauri desktop app baseline
steps: Run `npx create-next-app@latest open-recorder --ts --app --tailwind --eslint`
Initialize Tauri in the project (create `src-tauri/`, tauri config, and dev command wiring)
Run the Tauri dev workflow and verify the desktop window loads the Next.js app without errors
Verify Tailwind is working and there are no build warnings in console
Build a production app and verify it launches successfully

description: Minimal structure for folder selection + audio scanning + playback
steps: Create folders: `src/lib/fs`, `src/lib/audio`, `src/hooks`, `src/components`
Create Tauri commands: `pickFolder`, `scanFolderForAudio` (recursive), `readFileMeta`
Define the shared type `AudioItem`: `{ id, name, path, size, mtime, duration? }`
Store the last selected folder path in app config (so it can be restored on launch)
Run a production build and verify no module resolution or TypeScript errors

description: UI must match the provided screenshot layout and styling (dark desktop dashboard)
steps: Implement the dashboard layout matching `/Users/acaserop/Documents/Project/open-recorder-tauri/plan/Screenshot.png`: top title bar, left list card, right player card, bottom transcript card
Add a dark theme baseline: charcoal background, subtle border lines, rounded containers, soft shadows, and orange accent for primary controls/selection
Top area must include: left title 'Recordings' + subtitle count, and top-right controls: status chip with green dot, 'Sync Device' button, and settings icon button
Left list must be a card with rows showing: play icon, filename, and a second line with duration + size; selected row has a thin orange accent on the left
Right player must be a card with filename title, date/time subtitle, big circular play/pause button (orange), waveform visualization area, and elapsed/total time labels

description: Folder-based audio library (audio can come from any folder, not USB-only)
steps: Replace 'Sync Device' behavior with 'Choose Folder' (MVP) but keep the UI button label if you want it identical; clicking it opens folder picker
After choosing a folder, scan recursively and list supported audio files (at least .mp3; optionally .m4a/.wav)
Show recording count under 'Recordings' and update it after each scan
Selecting a row loads that audio into the player card and highlights the selected row
Add a 'Rescan' path (can be in settings button menu) to refresh the list and replace prior results (no duplicates)

description: Playback MVP (no AI analysis/transcription generation yet)
steps: Play/Pause button controls local audio playback end-to-end for the selected file
Display elapsed time and total duration; show placeholders until metadata is available
Waveform area can be a simple placeholder visualization initially (static bars) but must match the screenshot look; real waveform can be added later
Seeking is optional for the first iteration; if included, add a minimal scrubber that updates playback position
Stop previous audio cleanly when switching files (no overlapping playback, no stuck state)

description: Transcript panel remains as UI shell only (no AI features for now)
steps: Render the bottom 'Transcription' card as in the screenshot (header with icon + title + Export button on the right)
For MVP, show a placeholder body (e.g., 'No transcription available yet') and keep Export disabled until real transcript exists
Keep the footer row styling consistent (left-aligned meta placeholders), but omit AI-specific indicators (e.g., remove 'AI Summary Ready') for now
Ensure the panel is scrollable and visually matches spacing/typography from the screenshot
Verify the whole dashboard looks consistent at typical mac window sizes (no overflow, sensible responsive behavior)
